Description: Lip and wall sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup(?); inset sharply on inside only; wholly glazed save for underside of inset which seems incompletely painted; inscription cut upside down on interior of lip.
Curator's comments: Perhaps a cup, but if so it is unusually shallow. It would be a variant of the Castulo cup, such as Sparkes 1970 no. 471. British Museum 1965,0930,560 with part of Aphrodite's name, is from the same cup.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 66, no. 806, pl. XXI, no. 806)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 687, no. 454, pl. 22.2.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1667)
